comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/smu_cul_digitalcollections] Good deal!
One further note: Cameron Iron Works is known for a special type of continuous casting. They were the first to centrifugally continuously cast  pipe.
 [ I worked in the third and fourth steel mills to install continuous casting of billets in N. America].
 First was Atlas Specialty Steels of Welland, Ont. & Tracy, Que., 2nd was the Chiquaqua plant in Mexico. 3rd was Premier Steel, Edmonton, and 4th was a tie between Lake Ontario Steel, Whitby, and an American mill, Conner's Steel in Birmingham Alabama. Continuous casting raises the product finished yeild up from the mid 80's % in to the low to mid 90's %., which really pumps the profit margins. But all of that has been lost with the escalating energy prices! Pouring ingots is history for much of the steel making world now.
